title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus what we learned about each team this season
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings one more time ahead of Week 18. We also picked out lessons for all 32 teams in 2025.

title: Pats' Diggs faces strangulation, assault charges
content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs is facing a felony charge of strangulation and a misdemeanor charge of assault from alleged Dec. 2 incident.

title: Jokic avoids serious knee injury, to miss 4 weeks
content: Nikola Jokic suffered a left knee hyperextension Monday night against the Heat and will be reevaluated in four weeks, the Nuggets announced Tuesday.

title: Northwestern hires veteran coach Kelly as OC
content: Veteran coach Chip Kelly, who won a national title at Ohio State in 2024 as offensive coordinator, was named OC at Northwestern, the school announced Tuesday.

title: Sources: Colts to start Leonard over Rivers at QB
content: The Colts are expected to start rookie quarterback Riley Leonard on Sunday against the Texans, sources told Stephen Holder and Jeremy Fowler on Tuesday.

title: Utah All-America DE Daley plans to enter portal
content: Utah star defensive end John Henry Daley announced on Tuesday that he plans to enter the NCAA transfer portal.

title: Report: Watchdog didn't close case against coach
content: The U.S. Center for SafeSport, an Olympics watchdog agency, failed to levy its harshest sanctions against former gymnastics coach Sean Gardner.

title: Brees, Fitzgerald lead Pro Football HOF finalists
content: Quarterback Drew Brees and wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald headline a group of four modern era finalists in their first year of eligibility for the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: üèÜ Tracking the NFL playoff picture and draft order
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: 'We found our guy': Texas Tech's gamble on a high school coaching legend has paid off
content: Joey McGuire has his team in the quarterfinals of the CFP, but he was a relative unknown when he was hired.

title: 'Save college sports'? Texas Tech's billionaire booster has a plan
content: Texas Tech's billionaire booster has turned the Red Raiders into a powerhouse. Can he fix college sports next?

title: 23 years, 23 photos: A visual history of LeBron James' career
content: From The Block to poster dunks, here's a look back at the 23 photos that define James' 23-year NBA career.

title: Our favorite MLB games of 2025: World Series Game 7, four-homer performances and much more
content: From playoff thrillers to epic individual achievements, these are the moments we'll remember for decades to come.

title: Why NFL uniform rules have players feeling like a 'mannequin'
content: While NBA players rock sneakers of various colors, the NFL has strict rules, and violators can incur hefty fines.

title: Bracketology: Vanderbilt is exceeding expectations as a projected 2-seed
content: The unbeaten 'Dores weren't expected to be this good this season, but we could very well see history made in March.

title: Bracketology: Are the top seeds already decided?
content: March is months away, but UConn, Texas, South Carolina, UCLA and LSU look locked in on the top two seed lines.

title: Which NBA star had the best year? The 2025 Golden Basketball goes to ...
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton breaks down which NBA stars had the best year from January to December and crowns a winner.

content: The January transfer window is about to open, so let's look at which Premier League teams need to make moves to improve for the rest of the season.

content: From top targets to top backups, we've tiered QBs ahead of the transfer portal officially opening Jan. 2.

content: From Indiana to James Madison, we picked out every CFP player who could factor into the 2026 NFL draft.

content: The 27-year-old defenseman may be the Capitals' MVP to this point. Here's how he leveled up in 2025-26.

content: Bill Barnwell picked out what most impacted the NFL playoff hunt across the entire season, from the Lions' dud in Week 1 to the Steelers' struggles Sunday.

title: Puka Nacua delivers more 2025 fantasy football championships than any other player
content: The final "MNF" of the season featured two of the top three players rostered by 2025 fantasy football champions.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: The Usos are tag team champions again
content: Jey and Jimmy Uso take back the tag titles on 'Raw,' setting the stage for more championship action on Jan. 5.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Yildiz as Salah replacement
content: Liverpool are interested in signing Juventus star Kenan Yildiz as Mohamed Salah replacement. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Early Week 18 bets: Ravens-Steelers to be a slugfest; Drake Maye for MVP
content: Which lines offered value once odds came out? Here are games we are eyeing for bets going into Week 18.

title: Drill, dash, disappear: Robbers crack German bank vault; vanish with $35 million
content: Robbers drilled into a bank vault in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, making off with approximately $35 million in cash, gold, and jewelry. The suspects successfully breached over 3,000 safe deposit boxes before escaping. Authorities are currently investigating the incident, and the perpetrators remain at large.

title: Defining moment: India now 4th largest economy; when will it overtake Germany?
content: India has emerged as the world‚Äôs fourth-largest economy, overtaking Japan, and is projected to challenge Germany for the third spot within the next three years. The government remains confident about sustaining growth momentum despite global trade uncertainties.

title: World rapid & blitz: History for India! Erigaisi becomes first since Anand to podium
content: Arjun Erigaisi delivered a memorable performance at the World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2025, winning bronze medals in both events. He became the first Indian since Viswanathan Anand to get podium finishes at both the championships. Despite semifinal losses to Nodirbek Abdusattorov, Arjun‚Äôs strong showing in Doha highlighted his growing stature in world chess.

title: Amid horrific BBL stint, PCB calls back star Pak cricketer; here's why
content: Afridi suffered a knee cartilage injury while fielding during Brisbane Heat‚Äôs last-over win against Adelaide Strikers at the Gabba on Saturday night.

title: Ban on Starlink: China says Musk's SpaceX national security threat; What China fears
content: Chinese authorities have penalized a foreign vessel for illegally using Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite internet service, within its waters. Banned in China due to national security concerns and lack of operating licenses, Starlink's overseas gateway routing is seen as a threat to strategic interests. China aims to counter this perceived monopoly by developing its own reusable rocket technology.

title: India seal T20I series 5-0; Harmanpreet, Arundhati lift hosts past Sri Lanka
content: India's batting depth was tested but Harmanpreet Kaur's 68 and Arundhati Reddy's explosive 27 off 11 secured a commanding 175/7. Sri Lanka's chase faltered despite a mid-innings surge, falling 15 runs short as India completed a 5-0 series sweep. Deepti Sharma also became the highest wicket-taker in women's T20Is.

title: Watch: Vande Bharat clocks 180kmph; passes 'water test'
content: Vande Bharat sleeper train has touched the 180 kmph speed mark during speed trials by the Commissioner Railway Safety. The new train set is a sleeper variant of the popular Vande Bharat chair car service and is set to be launched soon.

title: Risk at 4.30am: How UP Roadways drivers steer through fog; demand for urgent fixes grows
content: Bus drivers in Noida are navigating thick fog, risking their lives to transport commuters to destinations like Agra. Despite hazardous conditions and the risk of accidents, drivers continue their duty due to contractual pay. The UPSRTC is taking measures like fog lights and speed limits, but inadequate expressway lighting exacerbates the dangers.

title: Chinese billionaire‚Äôs plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 kids; wants US-borns to run video game biz
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: Sriram Raghavan says he would never make movie like 'Dhurandhar'
content: Filmmaker Sriram Raghavan expressed his admiration for the box office hit 'Dhurandhar' by Aditya Dhar, but firmly stated that he would never venture into a similar filmmaking territory. He appreciates the film's success and compelling performances; however, he feels that its style does not resonate with his artistic vision or the evolving landscape of thriller cinema.

title: 2025: The year America normalised anti-India hate
content: Not to White Castle specifically, but to a sort of ‚Äòwhite castle‚Äô: where you are so integrated and assimilated that you are considered a beacon of society, an upstanding member of the Shining City on the Top of The Hill. A place where your faith was acceptable as all the other faiths that existed in the American tapestry.

title: California Wealth Tax: Billionaire Palmer Luckey warns; Govt may snatch your home, salary
content: California's proposed billionaire wealth tax faces fierce opposition from tech leaders like Palmer Luckey, who warns of forced asset sales and financial ruin for entrepreneurs. Critics decry the measure as government overreach, potentially driving away innovation and talent, while proponents argue it addresses wealth inequality and funds essential services.

title: Retirement that stunned Indian cricket - How Dhoni's Test career ended
content: Without any ceremony, 44 minutes after MS Dhoni finished his post-match press conference following the Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the BCCI sent out a press release. The news came an hour after India had managed to draw an away Test ‚Äî the first time in the previous 14 Australia-India Tests that the visiting team had not lost.

title: Keeping a goldfish on your office desk is a cruelty on that fish
content: Desk bowls, often seen as charming additions, are detrimental to goldfish. These active, long-lived animals require significant space, proper filtration, and stable environments.  Confined to small bowls, they suffer stunted growth, weakened immunity, and a drastically shortened lifespan, highlighting the need for responsible pet ownership beyond mere aesthetics.

title: Stefon Diggs scans stands for Cardi B after Patriots‚Äô 42-10 win over Jets
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
content: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk‚Äôs public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: Stephen Curry‚Äôs son Canon Curry stuns fans with elite dribbling skills
content: Stephen Curry's son, Canon, showcased remarkable dribbling skills during a Warriors game. The view captivated fans and the clip went viral. Comparisons to 'The Lion King's' Simba emerged, with many predicting a bright future for the young prodigy.  Canon, the youngest of Stephen and Ayesha Curry's four children, is already impressing with his talent.

title: Air India plane crash, Goa fire & more: Why 2025 felt like a year of endless crises
content: 2025 was a year of profound loss, marked by a series of devastating events across India and globally. From deadly stampedes at religious gatherings and railway stations to a catastrophic earthquake in Myanmar and Thailand, the year witnessed widespread tragedy.

title: Chess drama! Carlsen knocks over pieces, handed defeat - Watch
content: Magnus Carlsen lost his Round 14 game by forfeit at the World Blitz Championship in Doha after knocking over multiple pieces while under severe time pressure against Haik Martirosyan. The incident, his second outburst at the event, further dented his title hopes. Carlsen now sits fifth, struggling in Blitz despite recently winning a record sixth World Rapid title, as Arjun Erigaisi leads the standings.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Top 100 wishes, quotes to share with your loved ones
content: As December concludes, the world anticipates New Year's Eve, a global celebration of fresh starts and renewed hope. Traditions vary, from Spain's 12 grapes to Denmark's plate-throwing, all emphasizing connection and togetherness. The article offers wishes and quotes to share this spirit of healing and opportunity.

title: Khalida Zia death: EAM Jaishankar to attend funeral in Dhaka; PM Modi pays tribute
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will attend the funeral of former Bangladesh Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia in Dhaka. Prime Minister Narendra Modi remembered Zia's significant contributions to Bangladesh's development and India-Bangladesh relations, recalling a warm meeting in 2015. Zia, a pivotal figure in restoring democracy, passed away at 80 after a long political career.

title: 5th T20I: Why is Mandhana not playing? All you need to know
content: Smriti Mandhana was rested for India‚Äôs fifth T20I against Sri Lanka as the hosts made two changes despite leading the series 4‚Äì0. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur confirmed Mandhana and Renuka Singh Thakur were given a break, with 17-year-old G Kamalini making her debut and Sneh Rana returning. Sri Lanka won the toss and opted to bowl in Thiruvananthapuram.

title: 'PKR 11,000 daily allowance': Pay dispute rocks Pakistan hockey
content: Pakistan's senior hockey players are threatening to boycott the upcoming FIH Pro League phase due to a payment dispute. Players allege they received significantly less daily allowance than promised for matches played in Argentina. The Pakistan Hockey Federation cites the Pakistan Sports Board's USD 40 daily allowance policy as the reason for the discrepancy.

title: 'Do I get credit?' Trump repeats 8 wars claim; hot mic moment goes viral
content: US President Donald Trump again claimed he resolved the India-Pakistan conflict, stating he mediated an "immediate" ceasefire. However, India maintains the cessation of hostilities was a result of direct military talks, with Prime Minister Modi clarifying no foreign leader requested India to halt its operations.

title: 'No Christmas for me': National champ at 31, Gurjoat has just begun | Exclusive
content: Thirty-one-year-old skeet shooter Gurjoat Siingh Khangura won his maiden national title at the 68th National Shooting Shotgun Championship in Delhi, capping a year of technical changes and setbacks. Calling it just the beginning, Gurjoat sees the gold as a boost toward international selection, Asian Games goals and World Cup medals, stressing discipline, maturity and India‚Äôs rising skeet standards.

title: Tripura student murder: Cops refute ‚Äòracial attack‚Äô angle; one of 5 accused from Manipur
content: Uttarakhand CM assures strict punishment for the culprits in the alleged racial murder of Tripura student Anjel Chakma, with a special team dispatched to Nepal to apprehend the absconding accused. While the CM expressed deep sorrow and pledged exemplary punishment, preliminary findings suggest the racial slurs might have been misconstrued.

title: ‚ÄòUnsportsmanlike behaviour‚Äô: Aronian blasts Carlsen‚Äôs table slam
content: World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen once again found himself in the spotlight, not for his chess moves, but for his angry reaction at the board. The incident happened on Monday during the World Blitz Championship in Doha, after Carlsen lost to India‚Äôs Arjun Erigaisi. Chris Bird, the arbiter who was on duty during the game, later explained what happened.

title: Major disruption at Channel Tunnel: Eurostar cancels all services; chaos erupts at train stations
content: Eurostar has halted all services due to a critical power supply issue in the Channel Tunnel, exacerbated by a stalled Le Shuttle train. This has led to widespread cancellations and severe delays, impacting travelers during the busy post-Christmas period. Passengers are urged to reschedule journeys as disruptions are expected to persist.

title: Cracks in Mahayuti? Athawale cries 'betrayal' over exclusion from seat-sharing for BMC polls
content: Union minister Ramdas Athawale expressed his disappointment, calling the RPI(A)'s exclusion from the BJP-Shiv Sena seat-sharing for BMC polls a "betrayal of trust." Despite this, his party will contest 38 seats independently to uphold worker dignity and Ambedkarite community participation in governance, while still supporting the broader Mahayuti alliance on other seats.

title: 'Over-the-top': China sees red over Salman's Galwan trailer; cries distortion of 'facts'
content: Chinese state media, Global Times, has criticized Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan,' accusing it of distorting facts about the 2020 Galwan Valley clashes. The movie, inspired by the deadly confrontation, features Khan as an Indian Army officer. Despite the film's portrayal, the PLA remains resolute in defending China's territory, according to the publication.

title: Huge blow! Rapid weight loss delays Shreyas Iyer's return to competitive cricket
content: Shreyas Iyer‚Äôs return to competitive cricket has hit a roadblock, with the India ODI vice-captain yet to receive the required clearance from the BCCI Centre of Excellence (CoE).

title: CBSE Class 10th and 12th exams scheduled for March 3 have been postponed: Check new dates here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has revised the Class 10 and Class 12 exam schedule for papers earlier fixed on March 3, 2026. Due to administrative reasons, the Class 10 exam will now be held on March 11, while the Class 12 Legal Studies paper has been postponed to April 10. All other exam dates remain unchanged.

title: Was Putin at home during 'drone attack'? Kremlin responds; Kyiv says no 'plausible evidence'
content: Russia claims its stance on peace deals will harden after an alleged Ukrainian drone attack on President Putin's residence, a charge Kyiv denies, calling it a fabricated claim with no evidence.  India's Prime Minister Modi expressed concern and urged restraint, emphasizing diplomacy as the path to peace.

title: 'Suryakumar used to message me': Actress Khushi Mukherjee drops bombshell
content: "I don't want to date any cricketer. There are so many cricketers after me. Suryakumar Yadav used to message me a lot," Khushi said.

title: 'A Dushasana has come to Bengal': Mamta Banerjee hits back at Amit Shah, denies 'no land' charge
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee retaliated against Union Home Minister Amit Shah, comparing him to Mahabharata characters Duryodhana and Dushasana. She accused the BJP of harassing citizens during voter list revisions and using illegal immigration as a political tool. Shah had earlier criticized the state government for corruption and fear, promising a revival of Bengal's heritage under BJP rule

title: 'Body reduced to skeletal frame': Rtd railway employee, daughter held in captivity; starved by servants
content: A shocking incident in Jhansi saw a retired railway employee and his mentally ill daughter allegedly held captive for five years by their servants. The father died from neglect, while the daughter was found severely malnourished. Relatives discovered the horrific conditions upon visiting after the father's death, leading to a police investigation into alleged property greed.

title: Trump tantrums: How 2025 became a 'Big Bang' year for Indian economy
content: India's 2025 witnessed a 'big bang' of reforms, including tax relief, simplified GST, and liberalized FDI in insurance and pensions. These sweeping changes, aimed at boosting 'ease of living' and 'doing business,' seek to counter global headwinds and attract investment. The ambitious push signals a strategic reset for sustained growth and India's developed economy goal

title: Punjab shocker: Wife of former top govt lawyer found dead; servant tied to chair
content: A shocking incident in Mohali saw Ashok Kumari Goyal, wife of a former Additional Advocate General, found strangled in her home. The family's servant was discovered tied up, with police suspecting a robbery gone awry. Valuables and cash are reported missing, and the accused are still at large. The servant's account has raised suspicions, leading to his detention for questioning.

title: Tamil Nadu govt. is weighing its options on Chennai University Amendment Bill, says Higher Education Minister
content: Govi.¬†Chezhiaan¬†says there are  options available and the final decision will soon be taken by the Chief Minister. The Governor reserved the Bill for the President‚Äôs consideration, stating that it would go against the¬†UGC¬† regulations and established norms. ‚ÄúThis shows the partisan behaviour on the part of the Governor, proving that he is not fit to hold the post,‚Äù he says

title: 10 arrested for distributing swords in Ghaziabad after video goes viral
content: Opposition parties in the State alleged that the incident is part of a pattern aimed at disturbing communal harmony in western of Uttar Pradesh.

title: Khaleda Zia: a constant in India‚Äôs changing neighbourhood
content: From finding a mention as the wife of Bangladesh President in the diplomatic records of a 1979 banquet to hosting the Indian Prime Minister in SAARC summits, Khaleda Zia kept interacting with the Indian leadership and maintained a working relationship

title: PSA white paper says open access to AI infra key in India
content: The report‚Äôs view is consistent with the government‚Äôs own stand that AI systems need to be accessible to a wider range of the public, something that concentration in a few firms and ‚Äúurban centres‚Äù may tilt the technology away from.

title: Remove obscene, pornographic content, IT Ministry tells social media platforms
content: Platforms and intermediaries will face action if they do not comply with IT Rules that bar display of objectionable content, it says

title: Gig and platform workers to strike work on December 31
content: In a letter to Union Labour Minister¬†Mansukh¬†Mandaviya, they urged the Centre‚Äôs immediate intervention to stop ‚Äòexploitation‚Äô of workers by platforms in the food delivery and taxi service sectors

title: CPI upset about CM‚Äôs association with Vellappally
content: CPI meet emphasises need for serious introspection to understand why people had given the Left the short shrift despite the government‚Äôs¬†strong performance¬†on many fronts

title: Five dead, over 1,000 fall ill due to contaminated water from municipal pipeline in Indore
content: According to officials, several residents of the Bhagirathpura area have been admitted to various hospitals since December 24 after complaints of vomiting and diarrhoea

title: Mamata raises questions on terror attacks in Delhi and Kashmir, demands Amit Shah‚Äôs resignation
content: ‚ÄúThey [the BJP] claim there are infiltrators only in Bengal and none in Kashmir. Then who carried out Pahalgam attack? You say infiltrators exist only in Bengal, then what happened in Delhi? Who was responsible for the blast?‚Äù she asks

title: VPN barred in four Kashmir districts ‚Äòdue to security¬†reasons‚Äô
content: In the past 24 hours, the four districts of Shopian, Kulgam, Budgam and Srinagar have, in separate orders, suspended the usage of VPNs,¬†which allow Internet users to mask their locations and identity

title: Trump repeats claim of ending India-Pakistan conflict during Netanyahu meeting
content: U.S. President again asserts role in halting hostilities, as India maintains no third-party mediation

title: CBSE Cancels Affiliation Of Jaipur School Over Class 4 Student's Suicide
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) today cancelled the affiliation of a school where a 9-year-old died by suicide on November 1.

title: Delhi Court Bans All Construction Near Dargah In Yamuna Floodplain
content: The Delhi High Court has said people cannot be allowed to make houses or sheds under the pretext of a graveyard or for any other purpose in the Yamuna floodplain and prohibited any new construction adjacent to the Nau Gaza Peer Dargah.

title: Delhi Girl Who Ran From Home At 14, Sold Into Marriage, Dies
content: She left her home at the age of 14 after a family dispute and ended up living on the street, picking rags to survive before being sold into marriage with a man from Rajasthan.

title: From 5,000 Km Away, Shanghai Surgeon Remotely Operates On 2 Mumbai Patients
content: A surgeon stationed in Chinese city of Shanghai operated on two patients at a leading private hospital in Mumbai, over 5,000 km away, in what the medical facility claimed was India's first-ever international remote robotic surgeries.

title: J&K Cracks Down On Overseas Separatists Spreading Misinformation
content: In a significant escalation of its crackdown on secessionist propaganda and digital misinformation, a special judge in Srinagar has issued a proclamation against three accused in a case registered by Counter Intelligence Kashmir (CIK).

title: Ukraine Says No "Plausible" Evidence It Attacked Putin's Residence
content: Ukraine said Tuesday there was no "plausible" evidence it launched a drone attack on one of Russian President Vladimir Putin's residences, accusing Moscow of peddling falsehoods to manipulate talks on ending the war.

title: Maharashtra Civic Polls: Which Party Dominated Last Elections
content: After years of waiting, 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra are going to elect their mayors in elections scheduled for January 15, 2026. These include two newly-created corporations in Jalna and Ichalkaranji.

title: Delhi Jan Vishwas Bill Explained: Minor Offences To Be Decriminalised, Fines To Replace Jail
content: On Tuesday, the Delhi Cabinet approved the Delhi Jan Vishwas (Amendment of Provisions) Bill, 2026, a move aimed at decriminalising minor offences and simplifying compliance for citizens

title: Rs 75 Lakh In Cash Recovered From A Locked House Linked To Odisha Official
content: Vigilance teams carried out simultaneous raids at several locations linked to Additional Revenue Officer (Tehsildar) Jitendra Kumar Panda of Barang in Odisha's Cuttack district on Tuesday.

title: 3 Dead, Over 60 Fall Ill After Drinking Contaminated Water In 'Cleanest City' Indore
content: In the country's cleanest city, Indore, three people died and more than 60 people fell ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in the Bhagirathpura areaover the past week.

title: 18-Year-Old Skis To South Pole In -30 Degrees Celsius, Sets National Record
content: Braving freezing temperatures and gale-force winds, the 18-year-old daughter of a naval officer has become the youngest Indian to ski to the South Pole, the Navy said on Tuesday. In a post on X, the Indian Navy congratulated Kaamya Karthikeyan.

title: Newly Launched Shankh Airlines' Chairman Used To Drive Tempo In UP
content: Shankh Airlines is likely to begin flight operations in the first half of January with an initial fleet of three Airbus aircraft, focusing on connecting Lucknow with Delhi, Mumbai and other metro cities, Chairman Shravan Kumar Vishwakarma said.

title: Himachal Hospital Brawl Ends With Hug As Doctor, Patient Apologise
content: A week after an altercation between a patient and a doctor at IGMC here made headlines and triggered a protest by resident doctors, the two on Tuesday apologised to each other and said they have put the matter behind them.

title: India-Pak Conflict Due To "Terrorist Activity" Likely In 2026, Warns US Think Tank
content: There is a possibility of an "armed conflict" between India and Pakistan in 2026 due to "heightened terrorist activity", a report by a US think tank said.

title: Man, 30, Rapes 3-Month-Old Niece In Madhya Pradesh
content: A 30-year-old man allegedly raped his three-month-old niece under the influence of alcohol on Tuesday in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district, police said.

title: India Surpasses Japan To Become World's 4th Largest Economy: Government
content: India has surpassed Japan to become the world's fourth-largest economy with a size of USD 4.18 trillion, and is poised to overtake Germany to become the third-largest by 2030, the government has said.

title: Robbers Steal $35 Million In Cash, Valuables From German Bank: Police
content: Robbers used a large drill to break into a German bank's vault room and steal cash and valuables worth some 30 million euros ($35 million), police said on Tuesday.

title: Salman Khan's 'Battle Of Galwan' Angers China. A Look Back At 2020 Clash
content: The deadly clash at Galwan between Indian and Chinese troops five years ago is still a sore point that stings from time to time. Like now, when a movie has been made on it. China has vehemently objected to what it called "misrepresentation of facts".

title: Eurostar To Resume Train Services After Suspension Across Europe
content: Eurostar on Tuesday said it was to resume train services following the suspension of all services between London, Paris, Amsterdam and Brussels, sparking travel chaos.

title: Half Of All Cars Sold In South Africa In 2025 Have Indian Roots: Report
content: Half of the cars sold in South Africa in 2025 have connections to India-- they are either manufactured by companies like Mahindra and Tata, or have components made in India, according to a report by market intelligence firm Lightstone.

title: Rare Imperial Eagle spotted in Mudumalai Tiger Reserve
content: The bird breeds primarily throughout Western and Central Asia, while they also migrate during winter to parts of Africa, the Middle East as well as South and East Asia

title: Pawan Kalyan virtually lays foundation for Sankaraguptam drain modernisation in Konaseema
content: ‚Çπ20.77 crore project to ease drainage woes, protect coconut plantations; works begin ahead of schedule, says Deputy Chief Minister

title: Congress accuses the ECI of making arbitrary changes to the process of conducting SIR
content: The ECI was carrying out the SIR process in a hit-and-trial manner as it had not issued any clear instructions to the Booth-Level Officers, nor had they been given any training, Tamil Nadu MP Sasikanth Senthil said

title: A.P. High Court dismisses pleas challenging reservation process in Group-2 recruitment
content: The petitioners demanded that the reservation roster be followed in accordance with the Supreme Court guidelines and sought cancellation of the notification issued in 2023

title: Punjab resolution against VB-G RAM G Act ‚Äòundemocratic‚Äô, says Chouhan
content: Union Minister accuses AAP government of defying Parliament, flags alleged irregularities in MGNREGA implementation

title: Attingal municipal chairperson prioritises infra, waste management projects
content: A major project will be taken up in association with the Kerala Water Authority to  address drinking water scarcity in several areas

title: Kerala govt to launch citizen response programme field study on Jan. 1
content: From January 1, trained volunteers will conduct door-to-door visits across homes to record people‚Äôs responses. Named Nava¬†Keralam¬†Citizen Response¬†Programme¬†Development/ Welfare Study,¬†the initiative is a means for the government to understand the development needs of the people and involve them in the policy-planning process

title: Left parties condemn police curbs ahead of SEZ hearing
content: Leaders allege government move to suppress opposition voices over proposed ethanol factories at IFFCO Kisan SEZ in Nellore district

title: Railways to develop stations in Ernakulam to boost train handling capacity
content: The major works under the initiative include expanding the existing terminals with additional platforms, stabling lines, pit lines, and adequate shunting facilities, identifying and creating new terminals in and around urban areas, and setting up maintenance facilities

title: A.P. raises ‚Çπ4,000 crore through open market borrowings
content: The move towards the end of the year has led to the total open market borrowings in the calendar year crossing ‚Çπ86,000 crore

title: After backlash, ECI directs home verification for elderly, ailing, disabled voters during SIR hearing in West Bengal
content: Notices of hearings have already been sent to several elderly persons as well as persons with disabilities in The State.

title: 1,200 police to be deployed for crowd management at New Year revelry in Fort Kochi
content: New Year celebrations, mainly the burning of Pappanji effigies, will be held this year at Parade Ground and Veli Ground

title: Curriculum and textbook revision for Classes I to XII in Kerala nearing completion
content: All academic changes introduced will strictly follow the Kerala Curriculum Framework formulated independently by the State, says General Education Minister V. Sivankutty. Kerala will academically resist all attempts by the Centre to  force the NEP and unilaterally  impose curriculum changes, he says

title: BLAs can submit up to 10 claims and objections forms to BLOs daily: EC
content: Chief Electoral Officer Archana Patnaik says BLAs have to submit the forms along with an undertaking that the applications had been personally verified and that the particulars furnished were correct

title: GHMC‚Äôs footprint grows but civic outcomes lag in 2025
content: Civic body‚Äôs expanded geography and improved finances stood out, but ungrounded projects, garbage-strewn streets and reliance on last-minute flood measures defined the year

title: Gujarat approves Indian AI Research Organisation at GIFT City
content: The proposed facility will be set up under a public-private partnership model through a tripartite collaboration involving State government, Centre and the Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance, according to officials

title: Master plan for town, market renovation top agenda of Angamaly‚Äôs new chairperson
content: The Congress leader, who was elevated to the chairperson‚Äôs chamber after winning sixth term as a councillor, also said that steps for the beautification of the town will be initiated without delay

title: Prakasam district sees slight fall in crime rate in 2025
content: SP attributes the fall in crime to the deployment of drones, CCTV cameras and enhanced night beats in sensitive areas

title: Naidu delivering results-driven governance, says TDP Andhra Pradesh president
content: Palla Srinivasa Rao says Chief Minister restored public trust through accountability; party to launch grassroots outreach on welfare schemes

title: Himachal apple growers oppose reduced import duty on New Zealand apples
content: In a memorandum, apple growers urge the Governor to safeguard livelihoods, they say that lower import duties on New Zealand apples will adversely affect the industry in Himachal Pradesh

title: At peace meeting, Inam Veerapur elders say honour killing unfortunate
content: The village recently witnessed an honour killing in which a pregnant woman was killed by her family for marrying outside caste

title: FemiRides transforms women‚Äôs mobility and safety
content: The women-for-women mobility platform, founded in 2020 by Behara Vijaya Radhika, is quietly reshaping how women travel while also creating opportunities for them to earn

title: Chilly weather triggers a surge in tourism, Munnar witnesses hours-long traffic blocks
content: The traffic crisis turned fatal on Sunday when a 35-year-old man died after the vehicle transporting him got stuck in a snarl

title: Koli Kabbaligas stage protest seeking Scheduled Tribes status
content: Around 3,000 people from various parts of the district participate in a march raising slogans against the State government

title: ED flags ‚Çπ2,883-crore liquor scam in Chhattisgarh involving bureaucrats and politicians
content: Probe finds alleged large-scale manipulation of excise policy, illegal commissions, and off-the-books liquor sales between 2019 and 2023

title: Thrissur Mayor unveils vision for a people-centric, future-ready city
content: At her first meet-the-press, Niji Justin promises transparent governance, inclusive urban development and decisive action on roads, waste management, women‚Äôs safety and street dog menace

title: Medical camp opens for Sabarimala pilgrims in Kumily
content: The camp will operating until January 15 with 24-hour service during peak pilgrimage days. It will offer a variety of treatments including allopathy, ayurveda, homoeopathy, and siddha.

title: Sabarimala temple opens for Makaravilakku
content: Security arrangements have been significantly stepped up, with a 1,593 member police force deployed under the leadership of Crime Branch Superintendent of Police M. Krishnan

title: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inagurate Vibe 4 Wellness campaign on January 1
content: A Health departments survey puts the prevalence of hypertension in Kerala at 34% and that of diabetes at 24%  among adults above 30 years of age. Data from the India Hypertension Control Initiative, which is being implemented in the State suggests that roughly one-third of the adult  population has hypertension.

title: Free agent pickups: Look to Saints, Titans amid Week 18 uncertainty
content: the 17th and penultimate Sunday of the season featured excellent performances by new England Patriots QB Drake Maye, Cincinnati Bengals RB Chase Brown and New Orleans Saints WR Chris Olave . the Patriots and Seattle Seahawks each won their 13th game; the Las Vegas Raiders lost their 14th game .

title: Key matchups, players to watch and projections for CFP quarterfinals
content: a rematch of one of the most contentious national title games of the 2000s . a battle between new-ish money (Oregon) and new money (Texas Tech) the quarterfinals kick off Wednesday evening in Arlington, Texas . they could produce semifinals between four of the sport's biggest brands .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: OJ Arnold boosts Georgia Southern in rivalry win
content: we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . the best performances from the 2025 bowl season won't necessarily align with the official bowl MVP . check back after each game for the latest top performances from bowl season .

title: Premier League summer transfer overperformers: Madueke, Xhaka lead the way
content: the 2025-26 premier league season reaches the halfway stage with Gameweek 19 (Dec. 30 and Jan. 1) . some have failed to hit the heights and live up to their preseason billing . there are plenty of premier league players who have caught the eye by producing unexpected levels of consistency and top-level performances .

title: Our NBA cheat sheet for 2026: Big questions, awards picks and All-NBA rosters
content: there have been scandals (yes, plural ) that have cast a shadow over multiple franchises . there has been one ignominious ending for an all-time great in Chris Paul . we created a cheat sheet to get you caught up on everything that has happened across the NBA over the past few months .

title: ACC preview: Final Four contenders, more March Madness predictions
content: the 18-team league received its lowest number of NCAA bids in more than a decade . it hasn't been a top-three conference since before 2020 . the ACC had eight top-40 teams in 2019 compared to last season's four .

title: Falcons, Bijan Robinson run over Rams in Week 17 MNF win
content: Xavier Watts picks off Matthew Stafford, then Bijan Robinson takes off on a 93-yard touchdown run on the next play for the Falcons vs. the Rams . the team squandered a three-touchdown lead only to escape with a 27-24 victory .

title: 'World-class lethality': India inks deals worth Rs 4,666cr; what Army, Navy will get
content: defence ministry inked contracts worth Rs 4,666 crore for procurement of 4.25 lakh close-quarter battle carbines . the deal was inked with two domestic firms and 48 heavyweight torpedoes . 60% of the carbines will be manufactured by Bharat Forge, the rest by PLR Systems .

title: The good, bad and ugly: Big wins for Falcons, Niners, but what happened to Steelers, others?
content: the Texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . quarterback Derrick Henry carried the Ravens to victory over the Packers . the Bucs and Panthers both lost to set up a matchup for the NFC Souvenir .
